items.title: California voters take up Prop 50 in a push to boost Democrats in the midterms
items.standfirst: Californian voters opted by 2 to 1 on November 4 to approve measures to redraw the electoral map. The move, called Proposition 50, will facilitate Democrats in picking up five more Congressional seats in next year's midterm elections. It's a form of gerrymandering usually denounced by Democrats when Republicans do it but California's governor Gavin Newsom said it was necessary to counter a similar manipulation in Texas that would deliver five more seats in Congress to the Republicans.
items.content: Californian voters opted by 2 to 1 on November 4 to approve measures to redraw the electoral map. The move, called Proposition 50, will facilitate Democrats in picking up five more Congressional seats in next year's midterm elections. It's a form of gerrymandering usually denounced by Democrats when Republicans do it but California's governor Gavin Newsom said it was necessary to counter a similar manipulation in Texas that would deliver five more seats in Congress to the Republicans.

items.content: Democrats had a good night, winning major races including governor's races in Virginia and New Jersey and a redistricting ballot measure in California, while also confronting the future of the party.(Image credit: Alex Wong)

items.title: Zohran Mamdani: Mayor-elect of New York City
items.standfirst: Zoharan Mamdani’s triumph secures his place in history as New York’s first Muslim mayor, the first of South Asian descent and the first born in Africa. He will also become the city’s youngest leader in more than a century when he takes office on January 1st. More than two million New Yorkers cast their ballots in the contest - the highest turnout for a mayoral race in over half a century, according to the city’s Board of Elections. #ZohranMamdani #NewYorkCity
items.content: Zoharan Mamdani’s triumph secures his place in history as New York’s first Muslim mayor, the first of South Asian descent and the first born in Africa. He will also become the city’s youngest leader in more than a century when he takes office on January 1st. More than two million New Yorkers cast their ballots in the contest - the highest turnout for a mayoral race in over half a century, according to the city’s Board of Elections. #ZohranMamdani #NewYorkCity

items.content: California voters overwhelmingly supported Proposition 50 on Tuesday, allowing the state to redraw its electoral districts in response to Republican gerrymandering. The decision, backed by Governor Gavin Newsom, could tilt the balance of power in the upcoming midterms.

items.title: Progressive Democrat Zohran Mamdani wins New York City mayoral race
items.standfirst: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state lawmaker and democratic socialist, was elected mayor of New York City on Tuesday, becoming the city’s first Muslim and first South Asian mayor – and its youngest in more than a century. His victory marks a landmark triumph for the Democratic Party’s progressive wing and caps a meteoric political rise.
items.content: Zohran Mamdani, a 34-year-old state lawmaker and democratic socialist, was elected mayor of New York City on Tuesday, becoming the city’s first Muslim and first South Asian mayor – and its youngest in more than a century. His victory marks a landmark triumph for the Democratic Party’s progressive wing and caps a meteoric political rise.

items.title: UPS plane crashes at Kentucky airport in the United States
items.standfirst: A UPS Cargo plane crashed during take off in the evening of November 3, at the international airport in Louisville, Kentucky. At least seven people died in the crash, including all three aboard the aircraft, while around 11 others on the ground were injured.
items.content: A UPS Cargo plane crashed during take off in the evening of November 3, at the international airport in Louisville, Kentucky. At least seven people died in the crash, including all three aboard the aircraft, while around 11 others on the ground were injured.

ai_summary: A UPS cargo plane crashed during takeoff in Louisville, Kentucky.
The plane was carrying approximately 280,000 gallons of jet fuel.
At least seven people died in the crash.
Eleven others were injured in the incident.
The crash caused a large fire and thick smoke.

items.title: US Government shutdown hits record 36th day as talks remain frozen

items.content: The United States government shutdown reached its 36th day on Wednesday, marking the longest in history and leaving millions of Americans without vital services or pay, as President Donald Trump and congressional leaders remained deadlocked over health care funding.

ai_summary: The government shutdown has become the longest in US history.
The shutdown began on October 1 due to a funding impasse.
The previous record was 34 days during Trump's first term.
Democrats and Republicans remain divided on healthcare spending.
The shutdown is impacting services nationwide.

items.content: Brussels Airport is set to resume normal operations on Wednesday after halting around 80 flights due to suspected drone sightings. The disruptions come amid growing concerns over coordinated drone activity, with possible links to Russia.

clusters.title: Iran releases French pair after more than three years in detention
clusters.neutral_headline: Iran Releases Two French Nationals After Detention
bullet_summary: Reported by France24, Al Jazeera, BBC World

items.title: Iran releases French pair after more than three years in detention
items.standfirst: Iran has released two French nationals, Cécile Kohler & Jacques Paris, who were imprisoned there for more than three years on spying charges. The pair was arrested in 2022 while visiting Iran. In October, they were both given lengthy prison sentences. While the circumstances surrounding their release remain unclear, it could be the result of diplomatic manoeuvres by France.
items.content: Iran has released two French nationals, Cécile Kohler & Jacques Paris, who were imprisoned there for more than three years on spying charges. The pair was arrested in 2022 while visiting Iran. In October, they were both given lengthy prison sentences. While the circumstances surrounding their release remain unclear, it could be the result of diplomatic manoeuvres by France.

items.title: Iran releases two French nationals imprisoned for three years
items.standfirst: Cecile Kohler, 41, and her partner, Jacques Paris, 72, had been jailed on charges of spying for France and Israel.
items.content: Cecile Kohler, 41, and her partner, Jacques Paris, 72, had been jailed on charges of spying for France and Israel.

items.title: Iran releases two French nationals from detention
items.standfirst: Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris are thought to have been the last French people held in Iran.
items.content: Cécile Kohler and Jacques Paris are thought to have been the last French people held in Iran.

ai_summary: Iran released two French nationals after three years.
The pair were arrested in 2022 on spying charges.
They were sentenced to lengthy prison terms.
The release's circumstances remain unclear.

items.standfirst: Dick #Cheney, the hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarising vice presidents in U.S. history, has died at 84. He was the architect of the post-#911 "war on terror" and a leading advocate for the invasion of #Iraq.

The hard-charging conservative who became one of the most powerful and polarizing vice presidents in U.S. history and a leading advocate for the invasion of Iraq has died at the age of 84.

items.title: Bosses at six water firms had £4m in bonuses blocked under new rules, Ofwat says
items.standfirst: Regulator considers forcing companies to report pay received by parent firms after Guardian investigation Water company bosses were blocked from receiving £4m in bonuses for the last financial year – and the industry regulator is considering forcing companies to report pay received by parent…
items.content: Regulator considers forcing companies to report pay received by parent firms after Guardian investigation Water company bosses were blocked from receiving £4m in bonuses for the last financial year – and the industry regulator is considering forcing companies to report pay received by parent…

items.title: Bosses at six water firms had £4m in bonuses blocked under new rules, Ofwat says
items.standfirst: Regulator also considers forcing companies to report pay received from parent firms after Guardian investigationWater company bosses were blocked from receiving £4m in bonuses for the last financial year – and the industry regulator is considering forcing companies to report pay received from parent companies after a Guardian investigation.Ofwat, the regulator for English and Welsh water firms, said six companies had complied with the new rules governing the sector and did not pay out bonuses to bosses. However, it is consulting on further rules to force the disclosure of payments by other companies after the revelation that Yorkshire Water’s chief executive, Nicola Shaw, had received £1.3m in secret payments via an offshore parent company. Continue reading...
items.content: Regulator also considers forcing companies to report pay received from parent firms after Guardian investigationWater company bosses were blocked from receiving £4m in bonuses for the last financial year – and the industry regulator is considering forcing companies to report pay received from parent companies after a Guardian investigation.Ofwat, the regulator for English and Welsh water firms, said six companies had complied with the new rules governing the sector and did not pay out bonuses to bosses.
